message:
i want ask some stupid question 
it is to late if i want to learn another IT path 

for example : I've been studying the field of game development for more than a year , i done some freelance working , published 2 games one for envato  
i was thinking about go for Linux system and network security , not because i hate game dev but i fiend Linux system and cyber security more interesting , so should i stick with game dev or it is not to late to move to another field ??

data.message:
It is never too late to do something you love

BUT

Both gaming & cyber security have long learning curve

You should take your time to decide which one is more "suitable to you" not just hot topic out there

I think the more knowledge the better, having one years experience in any field is no big deal, maybe when you have experience with multiple fields you could use the combination of this knowledge to do something even better than you thought

It is never late, i was a game dev for about 2 years and i left it to android dev. Its not exactly a career path shifting cuz u still in the field so every thing you learned will add up in a way or another

Like others have said, it's never late.
Also, there is nothing weird at being in two fields at the same time.
Right now I'm doing both Game Dev and Web Dev for my Startup, I had to learn a lot of things in Web Dev (because it has been a long time since I last did it), and it was fun :)
Also a few months ago I was doing a mobile app with Xamarin for a project in a part-time job, and I had to learn Xamarin almost from scratch, and it was also fun in a way :D

So yeah, learn Cyber Security, learn anything that you find interesting, it will benefit you in one way or another :)
